message.content:
cs.MA, cs.SI, cs.SY, cs.HC, cs.NI 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.MA (Multi-Agent Systems) - Task allocation is a classic problem in multi-agent systems, and this paper specifically focuses on task allocation in the context of mobile crowd sensing, which involves multiple agents (smartphone users) working together to complete sensing tasks. 
2. cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) - Mobile crowd sensing relies heavily on social and information networks to recruit participants and disseminate sensing tasks. 
3. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The allocation algorithms discussed in this paper involve controlling the assignment of tasks to agents in order to optimize system performance. 
4. cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction) - The effectiveness of mobile crowd sensing systems depends on the interaction between humans (smartphone users) and computers (sensing algorithms), and this paper discusses how task allocation can improve this interaction. 
5. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - Mobile crowd sensing involves communication between multiple devices over a network, and this paper discusses how task allocation can improve the efficiency of this communication.
